p: This increase in disease risk, without any change in temperature, is on average low, but can be as high as 6.6% in some municipalities. Overall our sugarcane expansion scenario predicts an increase of 20% in the number of people that can acquire HCPS. The main underlying mechanism to explain this pattern is that sugarcane provides a highly nutritious food, leading to increased recruitment and a rapid population growth of rodents [ 85]. Sugarcane plantations are a suitable habitat for these generalist rodent species, as Hantavirus reservoirs, supporting greater abundances of rodents than other ecosystems, whether natural or agricultural [ 47], with sugarcane becoming a predominant part of their diets [ 86].
